item.title: Jimmy Kimmel returns, addressing Charlie Kirk and 'un-American' axing
item.description: Despite the late-night host's return, several US ABC affiliates did not air the episode, excluding an estimated one-quarter of American households.

item.title: How #RedundancyDiaries are busting the stigma of being let go
item.description: Camille says being made redundant was hard, so she began sharing her experiences on TikTok hoping to help others.

item.title: Report recommends gondola access to Jenolan Caves near the Blue Mountains
item.description: A report recommends building a gondola to the tune of $44 million to bypass catastrophic road failures that have long plagued the Jenolan Caves.

item.title: Doctor who lost daughter to brain cancer receives grant in race to clinical trials
item.description: A professor who lost his daughter to brain cancer in 2018 is hopeful the research to find a cure in children is just five years away from clinical trials.

item.title: Optus admits procedural failure before outage
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Optus to pay $100m fine, as crisis engulfing Australia's second biggest telco continues
item.description: In enforcing the fine today, the Federal Court's Justice Patrick O'Sullivan described the company's conduct as "extremely serious" and "appalling".

item.title: AFL boss hints at Brownlow voting shake-up after Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera controversy
item.description: Voting for the Brownlow Medal has been a hot topic again in the wake of Monday night's count, with the AFL open to letting umpires have access to statistics.

item.title: Christopher John Sullivan sentenced for stabbing partner Pauline Mountford in Gooseberry Hill
item.description: A 74-year-old man who slashed his partner's throat in their Perth Hills home is sentenced to 10 years in jail over the near-fatal attack.

item.title: Former A-League footballers Clayton Lewis and Kearyn Baccus sentenced over betting scam
item.description: Both players were paid $10,000 each to intentionally get themselves yellow cards while playing for Macarthur FC against Sydney FC to influence overseas bets on the game.

item.title: Gold Coast posts record tourism spend as mayor warns of public transport 'time bomb'
item.description: International tourists are spending more than ever on the Gold Coast, but mayor Tom Tate says the city faces a public transport "time bomb" that could ruin its reputation.

item.title: Thousands of Australians fighting 'cruel' battle for COVID vaccine injury compensation
item.description: Thousands of Australians who were injured by COVID vaccines say they are facing a 'cruel and complex' system to get compensation from the government.

item.title: Productivity Commission to review state and territory GST deal, including $60b WA windfall
item.description: Western Australia's GST deal, expected to cost the Commonwealth $60 billion by 2029, will form part of a review by the Australian Productivity Commission.

item.title: Australian War Memorial updates Ben Roberts-Smith display to mention recent High Court rejection
item.description: The war memorial's revised display now mentions Ben Roberts-Smith's failed bid to the High Court.

item.title: Brisbane Lions trust Lachie Neale to make right call ahead of AFL grand final
item.description: All eyes are on Lachie Neale's bid to make a remarkable grand final return from injury, and his teammates will back him to make the right call.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Senate inquiry examines federal environment department's SA algal bloom response
item.description: Officials from the federal environment department say they were not aware of the impact of SA's algal bloom until the state government contacted them in May, two months after the bloom was first detected. Speaking at a senate inquiry, department officials say the federal environment minister was not formally briefed on the bloom until July.

item.title: Alzheimer's drug Lecanemab approved by Therapeutic Goods Administration for use in Australia
item.description: The Therapeutic Goods Administration approves the drug Lecanemab, which can slow down cognitive decline in the early stages of Alzheimer's.

item.title: Super Typhoon Ragasa hits south China as death toll rises to 14
item.description: Super Typhoon Ragasa has killed at least 14 people in Taiwan as it struck the southern Chinese coast.

item.title: One dead in 'targeted' shooting at Dallas immigration centre, DHS says
item.description: Police were first alerted to the incident at 6:40am on Wednesday, local time, and later found the shooter on a nearby roof dead from an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound.

item.title: Kimmel monologue racks up millions of views on social media as Joe Rogan slams government 'dictating'
item.description: Kimmel's program was indefinitely suspended last week after he made comments about the late conservative commentator Charlie Kirk.

item.title: Australia's social media ban wins praise from Europe at UN event
item.description: Australia's willingness to take on the social media giants is drawing significant international interest, winning the support of the European Commission president at a forum in New York.

item.title: Australia in a 'dangerous place' as AI adoption ramps up, prompting calls to protect jobs
item.description: Artificial intelligence is coming for our jobs — but will it take them away, or just give us a powerful new assistant?

item.title: Who is really pulling the strings at Optus and what does that mean for you?
item.description: The Singapore government's sovereign wealth investment vehicle is the majority owner of Singtel, which owns Australia's second-largest telco provider.

item.title: Andrew Hastie taunted over claim that high immigration is making Australians 'strangers in our own home'
item.description: The home affairs minister says Andrew Hastie should name which visa classes he would cut after the shadow home affairs minister suggested "unsustainable" immigration was making Australians "feel like strangers in our own home".

item.title: Hastie downplays 'mischievous' leadership speculation – as it happened
item.description: Liberal frontbencher Andrew Hastie brushes off suggestions he is a threat to Sussan Ley's leadership after a series of outspoken social media posts.

item.title: AFL super fans prepare for the grand final clash between Geelong and Brisbane
item.description: From a unique tattoo to a personalised burger, the AFL grand final is more than just a game for these super fans.

item.title: Will food prices ever come down? Don't bet on it
item.description: While recent cuts to interest rates may have given mortgage holders a bit of a financial breathing space, the cost of food continues to creep upwards.

item.title: Free speech pathologist sessions turning poor literacy rates around in Logan
item.description: A federal government backed weekly reading session led by experts is helping improve literacy rates in Queensland children.

item.title: Independent review launched into fire ant eradication program amid 'closing window of opportunity'
item.description: Authorities launch an independent review of Australia's national fire ant eradication program to evaluate the country's fight against one of the world’s most destructive pests.

item.title: Families demand inquiry into NSW Police handling of missing persons cases
item.description: Nikii Smith is one of 10,000 people who signed a petition calling for a NSW inquiry into the handling of missing persons cases.

item.title: China retains narrow edge over US as South-East Asia's most influential partner
item.description: New research shows that China retains a very narrow edge over the United States as South-East Asia's most influential partner, with experts predicting it will soon pull further ahead as the Trump administration's policies begin to bite.

item.title: Solar, batteries and the 'phone charger dilemma': How a standards gap threatens clean tech
item.description: In the same way Apple and Samsung used different phone chargers, many clean tech products are not compatible with others. Experts say it is a big problem for the energy transition.

item.title: Family calls for change amid frustration at seven-year coronial inquest wait
item.description: Robert Hall was killed when he was struck by partially blind driver John Charles Robertson on the Horrocks Highway in 2018. It has been a long wait for the family ahead of the release of coronial findings into his death next month.

item.title: Rodeo attendees told to practise safe sex as STIs continue to rise
item.description: Health providers in outback Queensland are taking a light-hearted approach to promoting safe sex, as new data shows sexually transmitted infections are on the rise.

item.title: Elevated E. coli levels recorded at major NT crocodile farm owned by luxury label Hermès
item.description: One of Australia's largest crocodile farms, owned by a subsidiary of luxury label Hermès, is consistently irrigating with water containing E. coli concentrations almost 500 times the national guidelines.

item.title: Police launch fresh search of WA outback over Ray and Jennie Kehlet cold case
item.description: Detectives are this week revisiting the site in WA's outback where the body of prospector Ray Kehlet was found. His wife Jennie is still missing.

item.title: Former AFL boss Andrew Demetriou insists league would embrace a gay men's player
item.description: Former AFL boss Andrew Demetriou says the public would embrace a gay men's player and rejects that the AFL is an unsafe environment.

item.title: Indigenous teen speaks out against heckling of Welcome to Country
item.description: An Indigenous high school student's essay on the Anzac Day heckling of an Indigenous elder by far-right supremacists has earned her a nationally recognised award.

item.title: Magnitude-4.1 earthquake rattles Tasmania from Maydena to Hobart
item.description: Tasmania records a magnitude-4.1 earthquake in the state's south-west that was felt from Maydena to Hobart.

item.title: Who is Samoa's new prime minister, Laaulialemalietoa Polataivao Fosi Schmidt?
item.description: Supporters are fervent in their enthusiasm for Samoa's new prime minister, but voters who are more sceptical of Laaulialemalietoa Polataivao Fosi Schmidt, question his motives.

item.title: Hundreds of new dust-related lung disease cases recorded in Queensland
item.description: Nearly 300 workers from mines and work sites have had cases of lung cancer, black lung and other illnesses recorded by the state's dust disease register in the space of 12 months.

item.title: AFL grand final sprint won't feature all teams, as Gout Gout and Harry Garside to feature at the MCG
item.description: The AFL announces that only seven AFL players will run in the traditional grand final sprint, with Olympic boxer Harry Garside also joining in.

item.title: Macquarie to repay Shield investors after super platform failures
item.description: Macquarie commits to repaying thousands of Australians who invested hundreds of millions of their retirement savings in the collapsed Shield Master Fund amid admissions it contravened the Corporations Act.

item.title: China's President Xi Jinping announces new climate goal to cut emissions by 2035
item.description: Outlining China's new carbon targets in a video link to the UN climate conference in New York, President Xi Jinping says "green and low carbon transition is the trend of our time".

item.title: Katanning drivers fear the worst as untagged livestock roam roads
item.description: A Katanning school bus driver and local farmers are calling for urgent action to address a growing danger posed by wandering livestock on rural roads.

item.title: Nottingham Forest draws 2-2 with Real Betis in opening UEFA Europa League match
item.description: Nottingham Forest's long-awaited return to European competition ends 2-2 at Real Betis, with Igor Jesus's first-half double cancelling out by a late Antony strike.

item.title: ARIA Award nominations 2025: Ninajirachi, Dom Dolla, Amyl & The Sniffers lead the pack
item.description: All the contenders are hopefuls vying for ARIA Awards glory at the music industry's glitzy ceremony, taking place next month.

item.title: Peter Tonagh to replace Catherine West as Nine's chair
item.description: He replaces Catherine West, who spent 18 months in the position.

item.title: New stats reveal highest number of criminal incidents in Victoria since records began
item.description: The latest figures from Victoria's Crime Statistics Agency show the highest number of criminal incidents in at least two decades.

item.title: Andrea James to lead Ilbijerri Theatre Company as artistic director Rachael Maza steps back
item.description: Andrea James will take the helm of Australia's oldest Indigenous theatre company Ilbijerri, as outgoing artistic director Rachael Maza steps back after almost 18 years.

item.title: Man charged with multiple offences over pursuit, police say
item.description: South Australia Police says a Vale Park man has been charged following a pursuit that led STAR group officers and police negotiators to a unit in Adelaide's western suburbs.

item.title: Liberal candidate Gisele Kapterian abandons court challenge for Sydney seat of Bradfield
item.description: Gisele Kapterian abandons her court action challenging the election result in the federal Sydney seat of Bradfield.

item.title: Anthony Albanese addresses UN on climate goals, Gaza and Australia's security council bid
item.description: The prime minister uses his UN speech to talk up Australia's emissions plan after Donald Trump called climate change a "con job", and confirms Australia is still seeking a temporary seat on the body's security council.

item.title: Nicho Hynes shrugs off personal barbs ahead of NRL preliminary final between Melbourne and Cronulla
item.description: Accused by some of being too nice and not nice enough by others, polarising Cronulla star Nicho Hynes "doesn't give a rats" about criticism that comes his way anymore.

item.title: New head of Queensland's troubled DNA lab says backlog of testing could take years to clear
item.description: More than 170 rape kits caught up in the Forensic Science Queensland laboratory's backlog will be sent offshore next week for vital forensic testing, as the facility's new boss says it will take years to clear them.

item.title: Postal voting issues identified ahead of 2025 WA local government elections
item.description: Incorrect ballot papers are among several problems identified with postal voting packages sent out ahead next month's local government elections in WA.

item.title: Tasmanian MPs to receive $30,000 pay rise against government's wishes after upper house tussle
item.description: Tasmanian politicians will receive a 22 per cent pay rise despite the government's attempts to block it, after upper house MPs voted to accept a determination by Tasmania's Industrial Commission.

item.title: Scott Selwood takes break from AFL after 'personally challenging year'
item.description: Scott Selwood will take time away from football, stepping down as an assistant coach with Collingwood, following a year marked by personal tragedy.

item.title: AI image recognition technology used to detect traffic offences raises privacy concerns, Queensland audit finds
item.description: Queensland's transport department uses AI in its cameras to detect mobile and seatbelt offences, but a new audit has ordered called for a review into how that's done.

item.title: Breastfeeding in public is protected in Australia. So why are mothers still facing discrimination?
item.description: Last week a breastfeeding mother was asked to leave a Virgin Australia lounge for pumping. Experts says while there is a level of awareness that breastfeeding in public is protected, some people in the community still view it as "inappropriate".

item.title: What are Australia's chances of returning to the UN Security Council?
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese makes a fresh push for Australia to get a seat on the United Nations Security Council in 2029-30.

item.title: Snoop Dogg says AFL grand final is 'a way of life' ahead of headline show
item.description: Snoop Dogg has strutted into the MCG for his official appearance ahead of a fascinating, somewhat controversial, AFL grand-final entertainment set.

item.title: Denmark PM apologises to indigenous Greenlanders who faced forced contraception
item.description: The apology by Mette Frederiksen in Greenland’s capital, Nuuk, hopes to close a traumatic chapter in Greenland's history.

item.title: Forestry industry says it can meet demand for biofuels as climate targets near
item.description: With biofuels earmarked as a way to power the transport sector in the future, one industry says its waste can be converted into aviation and shipping fuel.

item.title: Perth grandmother Donna Nelson loses appeal over Japan drug smuggling conviction
item.description: Convicted drug smuggler and Perth grandmother, Donna Nelson, loses her appeal against her conviction for smuggling two kilograms of methamphetamine into Tokyo Airport.

item.title: Trio of space weather satellites launched to study the Sun's violent side
item.description: NASA successfully launches multiple satellites designed to get a better understanding of the Sun's influence on Earth.

item.title: TGA approves new brain stimulation device for treatment of depression
item.description: Some international users of Flow Neuroscience's device have labelled the wearable tech as a game-changer in treating depression, but not everyone is convinced.

item.title: Key takeaways from day two at the UN General Assembly's world leaders week
item.description: The world's most powerful people are meeting in New York this week. Here are the key takeaways from the UN summit's second day.

item.title: Wallabies vs All Blacks Bledisloe Cup: Team lists, what time is kick-off? How can I watch?
item.description: Wallabies prop James Slipper will notch an important milestone against New Zealand on Saturday, while James O'Connor will start at fly half.

item.title: South Australia passes laws to protect victims of personal injury from 'claim farmers'
item.description: Individuals who contact a survivor of abuse or personal injury without their permission to encourage them to make a claim for compensation could face fines of up to $50,000 under new laws which have passed in South Australia.

item.title: Ahead of the biggest game of his NRL career, Nicho Hynes returns to where it all began
item.description: Ten years to the day since his first moment in the spotlight, Nicho Hynes returns to AAMI Park for the most important game of his NRL career.

item.title: SA government grapples with whether it should issue daily bloom updates during summer
item.description: South Australia's Premier says the government is grappling with whether it should give daily updates on the bloom's location during summer, and says it has been "actively engaged" in conversations with the federal government since its emergence.

item.title: Firefighters race to set hazard reduction burns across Greater Sydney ahead of fire season
item.description: Sydney's wettest August on record has dampened efforts by fire authorities to meet hazard reduction burn targets.

item.title: Liberal veteran Amanda Vanstone chides Andrew Hastie for not being a team player, warns of runaway ego
item.description: A doyenne of the Liberal Party and veteran of leadership battles dating back to the 1980s Howard–Peacock era has chided Andrew Hastie for not being a team player.

item.title: Matildas strike force could benefit from having both Sam Kerr and Michelle Heyman firing fit up front
item.description: A fit-again Sam Kerr doesn't necessarily spell the end for Michelle Heyman's time in the Matildas, if anything the A-League star can't wait for her return.

item.title: SA Water fined $60k for causing 'environmental harm' during botched maintenance of Warren Reservoir
item.description: SA Water — which is owned by the SA government — has been fined for polluting the waterways with grey clay silt when draining the Warren Reservoir, in the Barossa Valley, in May 2023.

item.title: Lachie Neale and Rhys Stanley named in AFL grand final teams as Jarrod Berry fails to recover from shoulder injury
item.description: Brisbane's co-captain returns just weeks after doctors gave him as little as a five per cent chance of featuring in his third straight grand final as Geelong welcomes back a familiar face to take the place of Tom Stewart.

item.title: Measles case detected in Brisbane, prompting calls for vaccination
item.description: Queensland's health department says the person was believed to have contracted the virus in Bali, before visiting a number of businesses across Brisbane and the Sunshine Coast.

item.title: Gympie Regional Council votes to remove fluoride from town's water supply
item.description: Gympie scraps fluoride from its water supply and becomes the third region in Queensland to reject the practice in just over a year.

item.title: Coroner finds Monash Health provided unreasonable care before toddler Dio Kemp's death
item.description: Three-year-old Dio Kemp was taken to Monash Medical Centre four times over 10 days before she died of sepsis.

item.title: Mass puffer fish deaths and red-bell jellyfish bloom put Pilbara coast on alert
item.description: Hundreds of dead puffer fish are found on a Pilbara beach, as an epic red-bell jellyfish bloom prompts a warning from the region's ports authority.

item.title: All the latest finance news
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Fourth NZYQ member issued Nauruan visa as Labor steams ahead with deportation plan
item.description: The former detainee was returned to immigration detention on Thursday and could be the first person transferred under the multi-billion-dollar deal inked with Nauru earlier this month.

item.title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he will step down as president after Ukraine war ends
item.description: Ukraine's president has been in office since 2019, with elections slated for last year suspended by martial law as a result of Russia's ongoing invasion.

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs seeks to appeal to prostitution conviction
item.description: The former hip-hop mogul was found guilty by a jury on prostitution charges but cleared him of the more serious counts of sex trafficking and racketeering.

item.title: Out-of-pocket costs, eroding trust contributing to decline in childhood vaccination rates, new report finds
item.description: A new report finds out-of-pocket costs and eroding trust are contributing to a "concerning" decline in childhood vaccination rates.

item.title: China's 'soft' 2035 climate target frustrates experts amid rapid renewable growth
item.description: China baffles climate experts by setting the bar low with its 2035 emissions reduction target amid speculation the renewables superpower will most likely exceed its ambitions.

item.title: China aid and investment returns to Solomon Islands's Malaita province after ban
item.description: The Solomon Islands's province of Malaita made global headlines five years ago when it banned Chinese investment. But today, a new China-funded road project is on the way — and the people are all for it.

item.title: Traditional owners slam state premiers for 'disgraceful' call to push ahead with Santos gas project
item.description: The debate over Santos's Narrabri gas project reignites, with traditional owners condemning 'disgraceful' comments made by two state premiers.

item.title: Imported potatoes threaten Tasmanian growers, as companies look for cost savings overseas
item.description: Cheap potato imports from India and China are threatening the livelihoods of Tasmanian growers, as stalled negotiations with potato giant Simplot leave some farmers about to plant this year's crop without a contract.

item.title: 2025 AFL season quiz: Twenty questions before the AFL grand final
item.description: There are just four quarters of footy left in the 2025 men's AFL season, so now is as good a time as any to see how much you remember about the year just gone with our quiz.

item.title: As the government rejects Trump's UNGA rhetoric, Liberal leadership aspirant Andrew Hastie sounds decidedly Trumpian
item.description: As the government rejects Trump's UNGA rhetoric, Liberal leadership aspirant Andrew Hastie sounds decidedly Trumpian.

item.title: Police search for alleged Porepunkah gunman Dezi Freeman hits one-month mark
item.description: A month into the high country search for alleged Porepunkah gunman Dezi Freeman, a former detective says Victoria Police can not realistically expect to continue the manhunt indefinitely.

item.title: AFL popularity growth fuels calls to move the Barassi Line separating codes
item.description: Initially laughed off, these pioneers from Victoria were determined to challenge Australia's sporting status quo, and their legacy continues today.

item.title: Sudden 30C temperature rise over Antarctica upends Australia's spring outlook
item.description: Temperatures above Antarctica have risen by 30C, in a rare event that could potentially flip Australia's spring weather for months.

item.title: Southern rock lobster prices finally bounce back amid demand from China
item.description: After years of export trade disruptions, southern Australian rock lobster commercial fishers are hauling in catches that will fetch up to $125 per kilogram.

item.title: Albanese-Trump meeting not linked to AUKUS review: Marles — as it happened
item.description: Anthony Albanese's planned meeting with the US president has "absolutely" no link to the expected finalisation of the Trump administration's review into the AUKUS security pact, Richard Marles says. Take a look back at the day's coverage.

item.title: Palestinian Authority president thanks Australia, but points to decades of failure, in UN address
item.description: Mahmoud Abbas addresses the UN by video after the US refuses him a visa, as Donald Trump vows he will "not allow" Israel to annex the West Bank.

item.title: FBI finds notes by ICE shooter saying he wanted to target agents, not detainees
item.description: The FBI has searched the home of the man who opened fired on an Immigration and Customs Enforcement facility in Texas, finding notes that say he was acting alone and intended to target agents, not detainees.

item.title: ASX closes up, Singtel boss flown in to meet Australian government over triple-0 failure — as it happened
item.description: Singtel confirms its CEO will join the Optus chair and CEO in meeting the communications minister as the triple-0 fallout rumbles on. Meanwhile, despite a poor opening, the ASX regains ground to finish the week higher.

item.title: Robert Carlyle on the hacking scandal that brought down a Murdoch paper
item.description: Robert Carlyle plays an integral role in The Hack, co-starring David Tennant, which digs deep into the News of the World phone-hacking scandal.

item.title: Former Arsenal-contracted player Billy Vigar dies aged 21 after sustaining brain injury during a game
item.description: Tributes flow for Billy Vigar, after the former Arsenal-contracted player dies from a brain injury sustained during a match.

item.title: Bondi's Sculpture by the Sea offered $200,000 lifeline after financial woes
item.description: Sculpture by the Sea was facing cancellation with organisers forced to make an urgent public plea for last-minute funding.

item.title: Police say fire at Cheltenham factory deliberately lit by unknown arsonists
item.description: Police say a fire that consumed a factory in Cheltenham and damaged dozens of cars was deliberately lit by arsonists.

item.title: WA government accused of treating Port Hedland's water supply like 'lolly shop'
item.description: An Indigenous elder says the rapid depletion of Port Hedland's groundwater stores has been evident for decades, but the government has prioritised mining interests over people.

item.title: Hong Kong and southern China reopen after powerful Typhoon Ragasa
item.description: Hong Kong and cities in China's Guangdong province have reopened businesses and schools after the world's most powerful tropical cyclone this year.

item.title: Well-known Adelaide tailor Joseph Uzumcu fined for smoking outside CBD shop
item.description: A well-known Adelaide tailor has been issued a fine by the Adelaide Magistrates Court for smoking outside his CBD business to cope with stress.

item.title: Hiker with motor neurone disease takes on WA's 1,000km Bibbulmun Track
item.description: One week into her 1,000-kilometre trek of WA's Bibbulmun Track, 70-year-old Catherine Perversi says "the stillness is sublime" — and she would not be anywhere else.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Foster carer shortage in WA's Kimberley forces children away from country
item.description: A shortage of foster carers in regional WA is pushing vulnerable children, especially First Nations kids, thousands of kilometres from their families, culture and country.

item.title: Donald Trump imposes 100 per cent tariffs on branded pharmaceuticals
item.description: The United States will impose a 100 per cent tariff on imports of branded or patented pharmaceutical products from October 1, unless a pharmaceutical company is building a manufacturing plant in the US.

item.title: Freight train derails after collision with sheep truck at Bribbaree
item.description: A freight train derails following a crash with a truck carrying livestock in central-west New South Wales.

item.title: Scientist wins peace prize for farmer-managed natural regeneration work
item.description: A Victorian scientist whose farming technique has revolutionised agriculture in Niger is awarded an international peace prize.

item.title: Newcastle Ocean Baths the setting for new headphone theatre production, Meet Me at the Baths
item.description: A new headphone theatre production is set among the swimmers and sunbakers at a NSW city's much-loved ocean pool.

item.title: Health minister concedes tobacco black market has 'exploded'
item.description: Health Minister Mark Butler admits black market tobacco is now the single biggest threat to public health.

item.title: AFL grand final preview — how Geelong's unpredictable set up and late term heroics have set them up for a flag
item.description: From an innovative ruck set up to an uncanny ability to play out the quarter, the perennially competitive Cats are knocking on the door of another flag.

item.title: Branxholme Wallacedale Saints focus on club culture to become family-friendly
item.description: The Branxholme Wallacedale Saints have worked tirelessly to improve their once-troubled reputation so families and their kids want to play there.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Brisbane hellbent on ending horror NRLW finals run ahead of preliminary final clash with Newcastle
item.description: The Broncos have been almost untouchable through the 2025 NRLW season but the club's poor finals record in recent years means they can not afford to get ahead of themselves leading into this week's preliminary final.

item.title: Australian doctors become unofficial correspondents from hospital in Gaza City
item.description: In a ruined hospital and with little medication, two Australian doctors say the situation inside Gaza City is a "nightmare".

item.title: AFL grand final preview — how corridor control and the hard ball can lead Brisbane to back-to-back
item.description: They've had to deal with adversity all year, but the Lions are one step away from historic back-to-back flags — here's how they can do it.

item.title: Passionate Geelong and Brisbane fans cheer on their premiership teams at grand final eve parade at MCG
item.description: Thousands of Brisbane and Geelong fans have lined the streets around the MCG ahead of the 2025 AFL grand final.

item.title: Police legal challenge against Aboriginal death in custody inquest fails
item.description: A coronial inquest into the death of an Aboriginal woman in custody will be free to assess police actions, after a legal challenge by police was dismissed.

item.title: 19yo allegedly involved in gang rape granted bail in NSW Supreme Court
item.description: One of the four co-accused teenagers in an alleged gang rape in Sydney's south-west in December has been granted bail in the NSW Supreme Court.

item.title: Even without Trump's tariffs, Australian farmers are losing out on billions of dollars
item.description: Even without Trump's tariffs, Australian farmers and exporters of agricultural produce are already losing out on an estimated $4 billion of annual export trade each year.

item.title: 12yo girl killed in Great Southern road crash as long weekend looms
item.description: The fatal collision occurred hours after police urged motorists to drive cautiously ahead of the long weekend.

item.title: Vanuatu minister tells Australia to respect China policing deal, rebukes Pat Conroy
item.description: Vanuatu's internal affairs minister says Australia needs to respect his country's plan to sign a new policing agreement with China, and has taken a swipe at Pacific Minister Pat Conroy as controversy over the proposal rumbles along.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Geoff Ayling, composer of some of Australia's most recognised ad jingles, dies
item.description: The man who wrote the music for many well-known advertising jingles, including Good on You Mum, Tip Top bread and Take Me Away, P&O, is being remembered for his musical skill.

item.title: Woman charged with attempted murder after allegedly stabbing man in Kippa Ring, north of Brisbane
item.description: Police allege the 24-year-old woman stabbed a man known to her at Kippa Ring, north of Brisbane, in the early hours of Friday morning.

item.title: Why you might consider glass food containers over plastic
item.description: Compared to plastic containers, glass alternatives can reduce exposure to microplastics when used in the microwave and be easier to clean.

item.title: Baby koala rides golden retriever like a racehorse in south-west Victoria
item.description: When Steve Lamplough heard a commotion outside his south-west Victorian home, the last thing he expected to see was a joey koala riding his dog like a racehorse.

item.title: Timor-Leste scraps lifetime pensions after student-led protests
item.description: Timor-Leste votes to cancel the lifetime pension law for MPs and public officials, following student-led demonstrations against lavish perks in one of South-East Asia's poorest countries.

item.title: Melbourne thrashes Gold Coast as Kangaroos, Blues and Bulldogs claim wins
item.description: Melbourne, with Tyla Hanks and Kate Hore starring, has trounced Gold Coast by 87 points in their AFLW clash.

item.title: Cobblebank stabbing victim, 12-year-old Chol Achiek, farewelled at funeral in Melbourne's west
item.description: Chol Achiek, one of two boys killed in Cobblebank earlier this month, has been remembered as a loving brother and son who dreamed of a career in basketball and was wise beyond his years.

item.title: Nick Kyrgios talking about Gungahlin tennis facility
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Nick Kyrgios spruiks construction of $9.9 million Gungahlin tennis facility in Canberra's north
item.description: Construction on a new $9.9 million tennis facility in the Gungahlin has begun five years after the ACT government pledged funding for it ahead of the 2020 territory election.

item.title: At least three shark deaths linked to algal bloom, investigations show
item.description: Investigations into nine white shark deaths this year have revealed at least three are likely to have been killed by the toxic algal bloom. Warning: This story contains images that some readers may find distressing.

item.title: Six men jailed after police foiled 2.4 tonne cocaine importation operation
item.description: Six men involved in a drug importation operation described by the prosecutor as a "comedy of errors" are jailed in Perth.

item.title: Melbourne Storm reach NRL grand final with 22-14 win over Cronulla Sharks in preliminary final
item.description: Jahrome Hughes leads Melbourne back into the NRL grand final, scoring a try in a 22-14 win over the Cronulla Sharks just 22 days after breaking his arm.

item.title: Jess Fox puts aside shock of surgery to support teammates at home ICF Slalom World Championships
item.description: Jess Fox says she's recovering well from her recent surgery, and while she's disappointed to miss her home world championships, she's willing to play the role of 'cheerleader'.

item.title: Alex de Minaur powers through at China Open, Aleksandar Vukic set for big-name quarterfinal in Japan Open
item.description: Aussie Alex de Minaur is through to the China Open round of 16 thanks to a crushing straight-sets win over a local wildcard, while in Japan Aleksandar Vukic has recorded a second win to set up a tasty quarterfinal clash.

item.title: 260 alleged fraudsters from African countries caught in Interpol's romance scam crackdown
item.description: The scams targeted more than 1,400 victims who lost nearly $US2.8 million ($4.29 million).

item.title: Latest financial news
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Top stories from ABC News
item.description: Listen to ABC News interviews and commentary and analysis from radio programs like AM, PM and The World Today.

item.title: Benjamin Netanyahu rails against foreign leaders at UN as Donald Trump flags Gaza deal
item.description: Dozens of diplomats stage a walkout at the UN ahead of the Israeli prime minister's speech, as US President Donald Trump says: "I think we have maybe a deal on Gaza."

item.title: Anthony Albanese says Aussies are 'concerned' about far right's rise abroad, ahead of Donald Trump meeting
item.description: Anthony Albanese warns against the rise of populism and the far right ahead of his in-person meeting with Donald Trump next month, saying governments should "not seek to divide people".

item.title: Gulf states reevaluate US relationship as Israel replaces Iran as a threat
item.description: The Gulf, along with Israel, will be wondering just how far Donald Trump really is prepared to push Benjamin Netanyahu.

item.title: Australia's climate target doesn't eclipse today's tough questions
item.description: As a nation, it's as if we're arguing about where to have a family holiday in 2035, and whether we fly economy or business. Meanwhile, nobody can agree on dinner tonight.

item.title: How Alliyah's community missed the signs of a female predator
item.description: Gender stereotypes "play a role" in allowing predators like Kellie Whiteside to fly under the radar, but that's not the whole story.

item.title: The drug smuggling case of Japanese tourist Chika Honda and its parallels with Donna Nelson
item.description: A Japanese tourist who served 10 years in an Australian prison for drug smuggling offences sees her story reflected in the case of Australian Donna Nelson, who was sentenced to six years in a Japanese prison for smuggling 2 kilograms of methamphetamine.

item.title: Soldier, Shakespeare die-hard, and the next Liberal leader? Andrew Hastie's week in the headlines
item.description: The West Australian veteran has a clear vision for the future of the Liberal Party — and he's making it known.

item.title: Geelong and Brisbane's AFL grand final meeting a clash of 21st-century titans 25 years in the making
item.description: When they meet at the MCG on Saturday afternoon, Geelong and Brisbane are bidding for more than just the 2025 premiership. For the two most dominant clubs of a generation, true greatness is at hand.

item.title: Indians in Australia continue to face racist abuse one month on from anti-immigration protests
item.description: Nearly a month after anti-immigration protests swept across Australia, some in the Indian diaspora say they are still facing racist abuse and constantly "looking over their shoulder".

item.title: Swinburne University engineers team with builder to deliver Ballarat's first 3D-printed home
item.description: A new 3D-printed home build in Victoria's west is due to be completed in October, with the construction team hoping the technology could be another solution to the housing crisis.

item.title: Epstein files show flight with Prince Andrew and meetings with Elon Musk, Bill Gates
item.description: The documents include flight logs, massage messages and cash transactions in Jeffrey Epstein's ledger.

item.title: Gold Coast venue refuses entry to Māori man due to cultural tattoo
item.description: Caleb Pokai says he was banned from entering the Burleigh Pavilion while out dinner with friends due to his tā moko.

item.title: Sydney student compares his autism to 'limited edition Lego' in uplifting viral speech
item.description: Twelve-year-old Leo is the talk of his community thanks to a speech he made for his school's public speaking competition where he opened up about his neurodiversity.

item.title: Sydney schoolboy explains his autism and ADHD to peers
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Medical examiner reveals gunman who blamed NFL for hiding brain injuries had CTE
item.description: Medical examiners confirm the gunman who blamed the NFL for hiding brain injuries had CTE, after he left a note asking for his brain to be studied.

item.title: Man charged with performing Nazi salute at AFL semifinal was former political candidate with history of racist posts
item.description: An ABC investigation reveals Tylere Baker-Pearce, a former political candidate who has posted a selfie smiling outside Auschwitz, was the man charged with performing a Nazi salute at an AFL game.

item.title: The majority of Queensland councils are washing their hands of fluoridation under the watch of both sides of politics
item.description: Attacks by Queensland Opposition Leader Steven Miles against Premier David Crisafulli over fluoride this week are more than hard to swallow after another local government's decision to stop adding the mineral to its water supply, writes Janelle Miles.

item.title: Crocodile industry stakeholders urge Australian government to reform outdated code of practice
item.description: Thrust back into the international spotlight by the recent trial of Outback Wrangler star Matt Wright, questions are being raised about the Top End's lucrative crocodile industry and its outdated code of practice.

item.title: Best books out in September, from Ian McEwan, Patrick Ryan and Lee Lai
item.description: Wondering what to read next? This month's best books include the latest from literary giant Ian McEwan and Buckeye, a multigenerational family saga set in America's Midwest.

item.title: Retiring paramedic sounds alarm over plummeting job retention rate
item.description: Peter Maxwell and wife Rachel spent a combined 77 years as NSW paramedics, but they might be the last of a generation of lifers, with one in 20 leaving the workforce every year.

item.title: Persistent algae bloom causing political headaches as scientists are copping the flak
item.description: South Australia's algal bloom continues to cause political headaches for state and federal Labor. Perhaps that's why scientists are copping some of the flak now.

item.title: Nooramunga Land and Sea buys private islands to save them from development
item.description: For roughly the price of an inner-city apartment, conservationists have bought multiple small islands off the coast of Gippsland to protect their ecosystems and wildlife.

item.title: Donald Trump warns 'there will be others' after James Comey's indictment
item.description: Donald Trump expects more indictments to be issued against political figures after the former FBI chief was charged.

item.title: AI can't teach our kids to be curious and think critically
item.description: The AI dystopia might already be here but there are some things only humans can teach our children.

item.title: Detailed designs of new lyric theatre inspired by Canberra's natural landmarks revealed
item.description: Detailed designs show plans for the new 2,000-seat lyric theatre, inspired by Canberra's natural landmarks, which will host major musicals, ballets and operas.

item.title: Is it worth moving to Tasmania for the cooler climate?
item.description: Each of these eight families left the mainland in search of Tasmania's cooler, milder climate. But with challenges like health care, transport and limited services, do they have any regrets over the decision?

item.title: Conservation notice issued for alleged native vegetation clearing at Chittering
item.description: Western Australia's environmental regulator has issued a property owner with a vegetation conservation notice for the alleged clearing of a significant amount of native trees.

item.title: What time is the 2025 AFL grand final? Here's how to watch and everything you need to know as Brisbane and Geelong clash
item.description: Wondering what time the AFL grand final starts and how you can watch it live? We've got you covered.

item.title: UN officials walk out during Netanyahu's address
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Wool price soars as production crashes and Chinese demand lifts
item.description: Australian wool prices lifted sharply this week for a few reasons, including a shrinking amount of wool being produced.

item.title: Investigations underway after several Launceston General Hospital staff reported feeling nauseated and faint
item.description: Tasmania Police initially said the incident at the Launceston General Hospital was potentially a gas leak, but the Tasmania Fire Service later said it did not detect any gas.

item.title: Lachie Neale expected to start as sub for Brisbane against Geelong in the 2025 AFL grand final
item.description: Brisbane Lions captain Lachie Neale is likely to start as sub in today's grand final as he battles a calf injury.

item.title: UN sanctions 'unfair, unjust and illegal', says Iran's president
item.description: The UN Security Council rejects another last-ditch effort to delay the reimposition of sanctions on Iran over its nuclear program.

item.title: Police reveal link between man and woman found dead in New South Wales home
item.description: Police found the bodies of a man and woman in their 60s when doing a welfare check at a Coffs Harbour property on Friday evening.

item.title: The banal, brutal life of traffic police in South West WA
item.description: As WA experiences its worst year for road deaths in over a decade, the ABC shadows two traffic officers as they try to stop the number climbing higher.

item.title: For four years, Yuna and Minu Jo lay in a suitcase in a New Zealand storage unit. Now they have justice
item.description: Minu and Yuna Jo's bodies lay in a storage unit for four years. They finally have justice after their mother was found guilty of their murders seven years after they were killed.

item.title: Gladstone Strollers walking group creates a village for postpartum mums
item.description: A Queensland mum desperate to have a positive postpartum experience when she had her second child found that just a few small steps were enough to make a huge difference.

item.title: Trump visit to Ryder Cup not enough to inspire Americans as Europe dominates day one
item.description: President Donald Trump visits on the opening day of the Ryder Cup, but it's the Europeans who dominate heading into day two.

item.title: WA teenager starts petition for shearing to be in Brisbane 2032 Olympics
item.description: We saw break dancing added to the Olympic program for the Paris Games, and now there is a push for shearing to be included for the Brisbane Olympics in 2032.

item.title: AFL grand final 2025 Geelong vs Brisbane live updates — Cats and Lions blog, scores and stats from the MCG, Charlie Cameron kicks wonder-goal
item.description: Geelong and Brisbane are fighting it out for the 2025 premiership in the AFL grand final at the MCG. Follow all the action in our live blog.

item.title: Tropical Storm Bualoi sweeps through Philippines leaving 10 dead
item.description: The death toll from a tropical storm that swept across the central Philippines and southern Luzon has risen to 10, as the country's north continued recovering from Super Typhoon Ragasa.

item.title: Queensland's last flying-fox cash dispenser gains Lifeline in Gayndah
item.description: A not-for-profit organisation has created a new era for a heritage-listed shop and its nostalgic flying-fox change dispenser, which is the last remaining in Queensland.

item.title: Fortescue offers measles vaccine boosters after Christmas Creek outbreak
item.description: Iron-ore giant Fortescue says it will offer vaccine boosters after three measles cases were confirmed at its Pilbara mine earlier this month.

item.title: Queensland government investigating 'bungled IT system' which may have led to child safety information going missing
item.description: Queensland's child safety minister is warning missing information could have serious consequences, including the death of a child.

item.title: Tourist dies at Tasmania's Cradle Mountain National Park after group becomes 'overwhelmed' by extreme weather
item.description: A group of tourists who were unprepared for the extreme conditions at Cradle Mountain National Park is rescued, but one member of the group dies.

item.title: Cyclist on a gruelling journey to fight for a better future for people with dementia
item.description: Nicholas Tremaine is cycling more than 40,000 kilometres to raise $1 million to fight the condition that's befallen his mother and is now Australia's leading cause of death.

item.title: Painting of Gardening Australia host Costa Georgiadis unveiled at National Portrait Gallery
item.description: The National Portrait Gallery invited the public to identify a person who was missing from its collection — the winner, chosen from a shortlist of 25 remarkable Australians, was Gardening Australia host Costa Georgiadis.

item.title: Clive Palmer ordered to pay more than $13 million after foreign investor claim dismissed
item.description: The decade-long dispute was related to WA government legislation, which impeded Clive Palmer's ability to extract damages over the Balmoral South Iron Ore Project in the Pilbara.

item.title: Indigenous teenager teaches Paakantyi language to teachers at Menindee school
item.description: Jaz Fusi has been passionate about learning Paakantyi language for most of her life. Now, she teaches it to her local school's teachers and is eager to see other kids do the same.

item.title: Cobblebank stabbing victim, 15-year-old Dau Akueng, farewelled at funeral in Melbourne's north-west
item.description: More than a thousand mourners gather at a church in Melbourne's north-west to farewell a 15-year-old boy whose life was tragically cut short earlier this month.

item.title: WA government facing $400m cost blowout over Peel Health Campus redevelopment
item.description: The long-awaited redevelopment of Peel Health Campus is facing a $400 million cost blowout and potential delays, a leaked document reveals.

item.title: Live updates: All Blacks vs Wallabies, Bledisloe Cup at Eden Park, Auckland
item.description: The All Blacks host the Wallabies in the first Bledisloe Cup match of 2025, with the hosts smarting after a woeful, record defeat against South Africa last time out. Follow live.

item.title: Firefighters battling boat fire at Hillarys Boat Harbour
item.description: Thick plumes of smoke billowed over Hillarys Boat Harbour after a boat was engulfed in flames on Saturday morning.

item.title: More outdoor live entertainment for NSW after changes to 'outdated' development applications
item.description: Using outdoor public spaces for events and venues has been made easier in NSW under changes to development applications.

item.title: Relationship experts on the signs that it may be time to call it quits
item.description: If you are feeling indifferent about your relationship, have high conflict, or just don't really enjoy their company anymore, it is possible the partnership has reached its end.
